A:9
V:9

"Spoken language(s): French"
"NO SUBTITLES NEEDED"

You dumbf-u-cks.
From IMDB: "The little dialogue (mainly in French and Gaelic; I don't understand either) is pretty easy to follow, but during the end of the film I was left cold when I misunderstood small phrases."

This animated film uses an old script by "Jacques Tati" well known as a writer/director/actor in his more or less wordless comedies from the 30:s and forward.
This is ment to be in that tradition and if you find and use subtitles I don't think there's going to be a lot of them in the film. Mr Bean would be a modern example of that kind of storytelling.

excellent quality! thanks! and for those wondering if u need english subtitles..no needed at all..it's meant to be understood by the visualization rather than than the monosyllabic dialogue..most of which is in english already.
